intro: Pycnarrhena insignis, commonly known as the mountain lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it has a fibrous root system that helps it anchor in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pycnarrhena insignis is considered a vulnerable species.
